alert.note: Alert for Aitkin; Crow Wing (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 2:08PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Crow Wing and Aitkin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and remains forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Aitkin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Pumping begins at the wastewater treatment plant. Sandbagging begins at Aitkin city transformer. Water tops the levees on the North side of Aitkin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM CDT Friday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to fall through the weekend and into next week. River stage should fall below 15 feet late Saturday evening into Sunday. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.0 feet on 04/24/1982. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Mississippi River Aitkin 13.0 16.1 Fri 1 pm CDT 15.8 15.5 15.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. More information and resources about spring flooding is available at www.weather.gov/duluth/spring-flooding. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon by 215 PM CDT.
